RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the 2008 Chevrolet truck: 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the flatbed trailer: flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: Defendant in the case, driver of the 2008 Chevrolet truck, identified himself as a truck driver by trade, has a history of arrests including smuggling of illegal aliens and drugs, served 9 years in federal prison, suspected of transporting smuggled substances again
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: Party responding to Federico Saldana's motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court in the above-styled cause: Court presiding over Federico Saldana's case, evaluating the voluntariness of consent to search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico: Vehicle driven by Federico Saldana, searched by officers for drugs, subject of a traffic stop due to unsafe lane changes and near-collisions, with consent given by Federico Saldana for search, had oversized tires and after-market rims
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevro: Trailer searched by officers, containing a scissor lift and a piece of heavy machinery, had recently registered license plates in Laredo four days earlier to Daniel Martin Huerta
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: Veteran narcotics investigator with Williamson County Sheriff's Office, testified about atypical features of the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: Narcotics detective with Williamson County Sheriff's Office, relative newcomer to the narcotics division
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel Martin Huerta: Registered owner of the flatbed trailer, first name mentioned by Federico Saldana as the owner
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel A. Huerta: Registered owner of the 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston and Heather Vargas: Williamson County Sheriff's Office detectives involved in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Josiah Bennett's patrol car: Patrol car used to transport K-9 dog used for searching, driven by Josiah Bennett during the search operation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Deputy Jason Cox's patrol video: Video recording of the traffic stop, with audio that is not entirely clear
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cab of the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven b: Area where vehicle registration documents were found, searched by K-9 dog through front and rear doors on driver side
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled persons: previously smuggled individuals, mentioned in Federico Saldana's criminal history
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled substances: suspected cargo, previously smuggled by Federico Saldana, including narcotics and dope, searched for in the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana and the flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cocaine: Specific type of drug mentioned in Federico Saldana's motion to suppress, argued as having no reasonable suspicion for stop and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.methamphetamine: Specific type of drug asked about during interrogation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office video: Video recording made by Williamson County Sheriff's Office during the search, used to compare with Josiah Bennett's testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.K-9 dog used for searching: Dog used by Josiah Bennett to search the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.twenty four bundles of a compressed whit: Bundles that field-tested positive for cocaine, found after dismantling four batteries
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.specific type of smuggled substance: Twenty four bundles of a compressed white powder that field-tested positive for cocaine
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.scissor lift: Scissor lift with new paint job and corrugated metal plates under the tires
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled persons and smuggled substances: Individuals and drugs smuggled by Federico Saldana in previous incidents
